parts.title: Part 2 - HTML Text Formatting Tags
parts.videoTitle: HTML Text Formatting and Common Tags
parts.description: Learn about essential HTML tags for formatting text including headings, paragraphs, bold, italics, and underline. Practice writing clean HTML code with proper tag structure.
keyConcepts: Paragraph tags for text blocks and line breaks
Text formatting tags: strong (bold), em (italic), and u (underline)
Importance of properly closing HTML tags

question1.text: What is the difference between H1 and H6 tags?

options.text: H1 is for images, H6 is for text
H1 is the most important/largest heading, H6 is the least important/smallest
H6 is more important than H1

question2.text:
What is the purpose of the

(paragraph) tag?

options.text: To create line breaks and separate text into paragraphs

question3.text: What happens if you forget to close an HTML tag (like forgetting )?

options.text: Nothing, HTML doesn't need closing tags
The browser will show an error message
The formatting will continue for all text after it until the end
The page will not load at all

parts.title: Part 3 - HTML Lists and Elements
parts.videoTitle: Creating Lists and Understanding HTML Elements
parts.description: Learn how to create bullet point lists and numbered lists using UL and OL tags. Understand the concept of HTML elements and nesting tags.
keyConcepts: List items (LI) used within UL and OL
Understanding HTML elements (opening tag + content + closing tag)
Nesting tags - putting tags inside other tags

question1.text: What is the difference between <ul> and <ol> tags?

options.text: <ul> creates numbered lists, <ol> creates bullet points
<ul> creates bullet points (unordered), <ol> creates numbered lists (ordered)
<ul> is for paragraphs, <ol> is for headings
